page.title: 01Mynytho Village & the area
page.content: About 60-70% of the land is composed of farmland; grassland & cultivated land, with some woodland & wetland, while the remainding 30-40%, situated centrally in the block is upland moor & heath, with three or four granite outctops dominating the area. The biggest industry is farming - mostly small farms of about 30-40 acres - run by the families - hardly any farm workers. Some of these farms owned by the farmers themselves, but mostly rented from te local estate owner. A granite quarry produces rock for most local need, & also crushes rock for their own production of bricks & blocks, for building purposes. There are the usual artisans, joiners, bricklayers, plumbers, electricians - these are mostly one or tow man concerns. The rest of the workforce are employed in the nearest town as
